Dialogue:
AC: Hi there! How are you?
AA: Hello!
AC: Today, let's discuss my student days.
AA: Sure, let's look back.
AC: Let's talk about our student days.
AA: Sounds challenging! Is it about a class?
AC: Really?
AA: I don't have many memorable moments from then.
AC: What about club activities or first love?
AA: Let's start with you. How were your student days?
AC: I was involved in club activities. It felt like we were really experiencing our youth.
AA: That's great!
AC: Indeed. I even had a romance with a senior!
AA: I'd love to hear more about that!
AC: Well, we went on a date.
AA: I'm really curious.
AC: On my first date, I tripped on the stairs at the station.
AA: Seriously?
AC: I've never been so embarrassed!
AA: Your senior must have been quite taken aback.
AC: Yes, it was awkward and things naturally faded away after that.
AA: I might have thought it was cute, personally.
AC: Do you think high school students have that level of maturity?
AA: Maturity is something I strive for now.
AC: I see. How about your current love life?
AA: I haven't been in love before.
AC: Next time we meet, I'm going to ask you all about it.
AA: Let's continue our conversation.
AC: Looking forward to it! Talk to you next time.
AA: Again and again!

AC: Hello.
AA: Hi.
AC: Have you visited the 100 yen shop lately?
AA: Yes, bought cleaning supplies.
AC: What kind?
AA: Water pipe cleaner.
AC: Didn't know it's only 100 yen.
AA: Yes, but quality varies.
AC: Cheap items often don't last.
AA: Correct.
AC: Realized that recently.
AA: Example?
AC: A calculator broke in a month.
AA: Not durable.
AC: Not worth it.
AA: Better to spend more.
AC: Lasts longer.
AA: Yes.
AC: 100 yen shop has useful items.
AA: Many practical things.
AC: Like kitchen tools.
AA: Yes, like tongs.
AC: What kind?
AA: Tongs that can also be a bowl.
AC: Big?
AA: Normal size, drains pasta.
AC: Convenient. I'll check Daiso.
AA: Do that.

AC: Hello! Nice to meet you.  
AA: Hello.  
AC: Do you have insurance?  
AA: I believe I still have some that my mother made for me.  
AC: Your mom's kind! That's reliable.  
AA: But I often feel like I'm an easy person to deceive.  
AC: Really? How about you?  
AA: I think so. Do you have insurance?  
AC: Yes, I finally got one.  
AA: What kind of insurance is it?  
AC: Hospitalization insurance. I was considering a savings-based one, though.  
AA: Hospitalization insurance! That seems necessary now.  
AC: Does it cover coronavirus?  
AA: It might not. That would be unfortunate.  
AC: Have you ever been hospitalized?  
AA: No, I'm perfectly healthy.  
AC: That's good! I've only been hospitalized once.  
AA: Why were you hospitalized?  
AC: Appendicitis. I was discharged quickly, but COVID would take longer.  
AA: I understand that appendicitis can be painful.  
AC: It got better soon. COVID-19 hospitalization takes a few weeks, right?  
AA: Yes, it's important whether there's a bed available.  
AC: I've heard that's really bad right now.  
AA: Yes, it's fully booked.  
AC: That's concerning. I need to be careful.  
AA: Even if you're careful, you know.  
AC: It's about building strength and getting enough nutrition.  
AA: Let's do our best, thank you.  
AC: Thank you!

AC: Hello. Thank you for your hard work today.
AA: Hello. Your efforts are appreciated.
AC: Did you do anything today?
AA: I went shopping.
AC: What did you buy?
AA: I considered buying vegetables but decided against it.
AC: Were they too expensive?
AA: Yes, they were pricier than I expected.
AC: Prices have been increasing lately, haven’t they?
AA: Yes, it’s inconvenient.
AC: Normally, summer vegetables should be more affordable.
AA: The heat might be affecting the prices.
AC: Do you cook for yourself?
AA: Occasionally.
AC: Are you good at cooking?
AA: Not really.
AC: I adjust the seasoning to my own taste.
AA: Family reactions can be mixed.
AC: Do you use recipes or the internet?
AA: Sometimes, but it doesn’t always help.
AC: Do you taste it as you cook?
AA: Yes, but it often tastes off.
AC: Do you then make adjustments?
AA: Yes, but it can make it worse.
AC: The taste can vary with the temperature.
AA: Are you good at cooking?
AC: Not really. I rely on mentsuyu.
AA: Mentsuyu is useful.
AC: Yes, it’s essential in Japanese cooking.
AA: Understood.

AC: Hello!
AA: Hello! How can I assist you today?
AC: Have you been to an amusement park lately?
AA: No, I haven't. Have you?
AC: Me neither. I want to visit tourist spots like Disneyland.
AA: Disney was less crowded during the peak of COVID.
AC: That would have been a good time to visit.
AA: Yes, it was reservation-only for a while, but not anymore.
AC: So, it required reservations then.
AA: Correct, and it was quite empty.
AC: It's hard to imagine an empty Disneyland.
AA: Normally, attractions have long wait times.
AC: No waiting would make it a fulfilling day.
AA: Do you prefer Disneyland or DisneySea?
AC: I've never been to DisneySea.
AA: Is that so?
AC: I used to live nearby and got tired of the fireworks.
AA: Did you live near Maihama?
AC: Yes, being close made me hesitant to visit. But seeing it from afar makes me want to go.
AA: Locals often don't visit as often.
AC: Exactly. I've never been to Tokyo Tower either.
AA: Where do you live now?
AC: I'm at the westernmost tip of Kyushu.
AA: That's quite a move.
AC: Yes, I miss Mount Fuji since I moved.
AA: Is it near Kagoshima?
AC: In that direction, but not close to Sakurajima.
AA: I'm planning to visit Kagoshima in October.
AC: Enjoy! The food there is delicious.
AA: Noted. Thank you.

AC: Hello, nice to meet you.
AA: Hello, nice to meet you.
AC: Do you participate in hometown tax donations?
AA: Were you considering it?
AC: Yes.
AA: What did you receive as a return gift?
AC: Aladdin's toaster.
AA: Really? That's impressive.
AC: Yes, it cost 2000 yen.
AA: Which city offered that?
AC: Hyogo. They produce graphite heaters there.
AA: Did you use Rakuten's hometown tax donation?
AC: Yes.
AA: Rakuten provides a variety of options.
AC: Yes, I found it while searching normally.
AA: Convenient. You contributed and got rewarded.
AC: Yes, plus Rakuten points.
AA: Rakuten has numerous campaigns, spending can accumulate.
AC: Yes, shopping gets intense.
AA: New items frequently appear.
AC: It feels never-ending.
AA: Why does this keep happening?
AC: Rakuten’s marketing is very effective.
AA: Their strategies work well.
AC: I agree. One-day coupons are hard to resist.
AA: They encourage quick decisions.
AC: Yes. Be cautious about overspending.
AA: I will keep an eye on my budget. Thank you.

AC: Hello!
AA: Good evening.
AC: Is it already that time?
AA: Yes, it is.
AC: Days are getting shorter.
AA: Correct. What time do you switch greetings?
AC: Maybe when the evening chime rings?
AA: Typically around 5 o'clock.
AC: Will it ring here?
AA: Not in this area.
AC: Because of the fields?
AA: Possibly. My friend's area has it.
AC: As a child, I hurried home when it rang.
AA: There was a curfew then.
AC: Yes, playing outside made you lose track of time.
AA: How did we check time back then?
AC: I asked strangers if I didn’t have a watch.
AA: Yes, they would tell us. That’s rare now.
AC: People are cautious these days.
AA: Innocent actions can seem suspicious.
AC: I avoid staring at children.
AA: It’s less convenient now.
AC: Strangers used to scold us.
AA: We talked more naturally back then.
AC: Yes.
AA: It's more convenient now but less personal.
AC: I miss when strangers gave us candy or tangerines.
AA: That did happen. We visited each other’s houses.
AC: That was the Showa era.
AA: Understood.
AC: Okay! Goodbye.

AC: Good evening.
AA: Good evening.
AC: Have you decided on dinner?
AA: Not yet.
AC: Meat or fish?
AA: Meat.
AC: Chicken is a good option.
AA: Chicken is healthy and affordable.
AC: It's economical.
AA: Affordability matters when living alone.
AC: Chicken breast is cost-effective.
AA: Do you prefer fish or meat?
AC: I like grilled fish like Pacific saury.
AA: Grilled saury is good in autumn.
AC: It pairs well with rice and beer.
AA: Sets an autumn mood.
AC: Autumn offers many delicious foods and fruits.
AA: Yes, many options to enjoy.
AC: New rice is a highlight.
AA: It's anticipated.
AC: Very enjoyable.
AA: I tried premium rice recently; it was excellent.
AC: Was it branded rice?
AA: Yes, Milky Queen.
AC: Is it from Hokkaido?
AA: Not sure, but the packaging was premium.
AC: I will consider buying it this fall.
AA: I recommend it.
